title.narrative: EISA- Support to Mozambique electoral process 2018/2019

description.narrative:
Denna insats, som genomförs av den regionala civilsamhällesorganisationen EISA (Electoral Institute for Sustainable Democracy in Africa), med huvudkontor i Sydafrika, syftar till att bidra till en mer trovärdig valprocess för nästkommande val 2018 (lokalval) och 2019 (parlaments- och presidentval). Detta skall ske genom att förbättra de huvudsakliga intressenternas, t.ex. valmyndigheterna, de politiska partierna och det civila samhällets, engagemang i valprocessen genom; att de politiska partierna mer effektivt deltar i god samhällsstyrning och valobservation; att det juridiska och institutionella ramverket för val förbättras; samt att medborgerligt engagemang förstärks.
Aktiviteterna kommer att omfatta kapacitetsutveckling så som utbildning, mentorskap och teknisk assistans.
De huvudsakliga målgrupperna är de tre största politiska partierna i Moçambique, valmyndigheterna (inklusive domstolsväsendet) och det Moçambikiska civilsamhället som engagerar sig i valfrågor (organisationer men även media).
Programmet har ett holistiskt och omfattande angreppssätt. EISAs långa erfarenhet, 20 år, av att arbeta med valfrågor i Afrika har visat att graden av framgång inom ett program som berör valprocesser är avhängigt huruvida programmet lyckas skapa synergier mellan olika aktivitetsområden, samtidigt som det är viktigt att fokusera på den fullständiga valcykeln - förberedelser inför val (existens av bra vallag, registrering av väljare, valkampanjer), valdagen, samt avslut av valet (rösträkning, delgivande av valresultat), etc.
Insatsen avser därför bidra till resultat inom tre olika kompletterande områden; 1. Stärkta politiska partier som under perioden (2016 - 2019), på ett mer effektivt sätt, skall delta i god samhällstyrning och valobservation. 2. Förbättrat juridiskt och institutionellt ramverk för valprocessen 2018/2019. 3. Stärkt medborgerligt deltagande i valprocessen 2018/2019.
Det övergripande målet för insatsen är "en mer trovärdig valprocess för nästkommande valperiod 2018/2019". Resultat kommer att innefatta; - Mer demokratiska och organisationellt starkare politiska partier. - Mer aktiva politiska partier som mer effektivt deltar i offentligt policyarbete och i parlamentets arbete. - Bättre förberedda politiska partier inför valperioden 2018/2019. - En förbättrad vallag. - Förbättrad kapacitet hos valmyndigheterna att genomföra valen 2018 & 2019. - Förbättrat arbete, bland nyckelintressenter som t.ex. domstolsväsendet, under valcykeln 2018/2019. - Ett återupplivat och förstärkt medborgerligt engagemang vad avser att observera valcykeln 2018/2019. - Professionalism och modernisering av medborgerliga valobservationsinitiativ. - Valobservation av EISA under valen 2018 och 2019.
Support to EISA for implementation of the Electoral Process and Framework Strengthening Programme in Mozambique.

tag.narrative: 16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.

description.narrative: EISA aims to reach the expected programme outcomes through capacity development activities, such as training, mentoring, and technical assistance. The primary beneficiaries of the programme are the three main political parties in Mozambique, namely FRELIMO, RENAMO and MDM, the election management bodies, including the National Electoral Commission (CNE/STAE ) and the legal system (courts), and Mozambican civil society organisations involved in citizen election observation activities. The year 2017 was treated as an inception phase, during which EISA carried out a dialogue with the beneficiary partners of the programme to determine their needs, and developed joint implementation instruments through Memoranda of Understanding and work-plans. This process, for different reasons was relatively slow. First in the last quarter of the year the MoUs and working plans were on place and the activities started. Reporting from 2017 shows that EISA was able to support the strengthening and revitalisation of party national and local structures within the three main parties and the fulfillment of their internal democracy requirements. For example, EISA supported the logistical organisation of trainings adressing internal party regulations and policies, as well as the organisation of party congresses. Moreover, EISA contributed to an improvement of the technical and policy knowledge of MPs in themes such as state budgeting process and public accounts management. Additionally, EISA was developing the capacity of one of the party's women's and youth leagues e.g. with the provision of training on leadership and communication, on outreach strategies, on internal organisational issues including strategies to increase female participation in the league's decision-making process, as well as on the role and engagement of party youth/women in the monitoring of public policy. EISA also managed to support the electoral managment bodies' (CNE & STAE) first national meeting after the Government announced the date for the 2018 municipal elections. Both national and provinical staff from both bodies took part. EISA's logistical and financial support to this meeting was critical in order to ensure that the election calendar and plan of action could be approved in a timely manner. The approval of the election calendar and plan of action by the CNE plenary, which are then published by the official gazette, have the force of a law and allow CNE to legally implement the requirements of the electoral legislation so as to ensure the electoral process. EISA also supported exchanges of experience between CNE/STAE and their regional counterparts as well as witha few European equivalents as part of their capacity building. Additionally, EISA started a dialogue with CNE with the view of developing a CNE Gender and Inclusion Policy as a way of motivating them to enable the collection, recording and publication of sex disaggregated gender and age data related to voter registration and voting. EISA has also trained judges from district courts, prosecutors and senior police officers in managing electoral disputes and in electoral crime. Together with civil society, EISA initiated efforts to facilitate the estblishment of a new platform for citizen observation. EISA will support this platform with the design of observation missions, training of observers, development of observation tools (checklists, deployment plans), as well as with parallel voter tabulations.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
